channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: All new smartphones, tablets and laptops in the EU will be required to use a USB-C charger by 2026, under an agreement reached on Tuesday. The new law had been opposed by companies including Apple. https://t.co/tqsjWKGi5t

Federal authorities intend to seize two aircraft believed to be owned by Roman Abramovich, saying that the Russian oligarch violated strict U.S. export regulations linked to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, according to new court filings. https://t.co/Am2hBoQPIX
A federal judge ruled on Monday that Louisiana’s new congressional map represented a racial gerrymander and must be redrawn. https://t.co/S8k667gFg4

A Florida woman was charged with manslaughter on Monday after her 2-year-old boy found a gun in their home and accidentally shot his father in the back, killing him, the authorities said. https://t.co/7I9kIECv2v

Fiji handed over to the U.S. a $325 million superyacht that American investigators say is owned by a Russian billionaire on a U.S. sanctions list, the island nation’s top prosecutor said. https://t.co/1JGgrRoRn0

Three Tempe, Arizona, police officers are on paid leave amid an investigation into their response to a man who jumped into a lake and, despite his repeated pleas for help, drowned as the officers watched, newly released video footage and records show. https://t.co/u66Oww7iAQ

A British journalist and a Brazilian expert on Indigenous peoples have been reported missing deep inside the Amazon rainforest, after the expert’s organization said it had received threats for its work monitoring illegal mining and fishing in the area. https://t.co/fF5RwHk8lG

A British journalist and a Brazilian expert on Indigenous peoples have been reported missing deep inside the Amazon rainforest, after the expert’s organization said it had received threats for its work monitoring illegal mining and fishing in the area. https://t.co/VMQQqUv9wl
"Crying in H Mart" has stayed on the New York Times best-seller list for more than 40 weeks. We spoke to Michelle Zauner about the runaway best seller — and what comes next. https://t.co/NNQJ96zC7M
A federal judge ruled on Monday that Louisiana’s new congressional map represented a racial gerrymander and must be redrawn. https://t.co/C2HiM4OEeD

A Florida woman was charged with manslaughter on Monday after her 2-year-old boy found a gun in their home and accidentally shot his father in the back, killing him, the authorities said. https://t.co/zgL0FnCvbF

Suffolk County on Long Island aggressively uses New York's "red flag" law to take guns from people in crisis. A New York Times examination of more than 100 cases filed in the county shows how that law has defused dozens of dangerous situations. https://t.co/qvDU5gCWNY

The president of Mexico, Andrés Manuel López Obrador, will not attend the Summit of the Americas. Obrador said he made the decision, a blow to President Biden, because Cuba, Nicaragua and Venezuela were not invited to the meeting. https://t.co/tHOvxinp7H

A day before the Jan. 6 assault on the Capitol, an aide to Mike Pence warned of a security risk to the vice president, saying President Donald Trump was going to publicly turn on him. https://t.co/qP538AW6x8

Breaking News: Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain faces a no-confidence vote after months of crisis over lockdown-breaking parties at Downing Street.
Follow our live updates. https://t.co/lfUGE9MKZK
Breaking News: Five members of the Proud Boys, including the group’s former leader, Enrique Tarrio, were charged with seditious conspiracy for their roles in the Jan. 6 riot. https://t.co/2CdBwxo57q

The U.S. alerted 14 countries, mostly in Africa, that Russian ships carrying stolen Ukrainian grain could be headed their way, posing a dilemma to countries facing dire food shortages. https://t.co/nl9tmN49uP

"There were a lot of happy tears."
It was a small trial, just 18 rectal cancer patients, every one of whom took the same drug.
But the results were astonishing. The cancer vanished in every single patient. https://t.co/OwTCoylWYl
Breaking News: Elon Musk threatened to pull out of his $44 billion deal with Twitter, accusing the platform of “resisting” requests for data about fake accounts. https://t.co/CsYvrHAa2N

President Volodymyr Zelensky met soldiers and handed out military awards near the frontline in eastern Ukraine, in a visit aimed at boosting morale.
“I am proud of everyone with whom I met, whom I shook hands with,” he said of his visit. https://t.co/hshtbG131A https://t.co/4tSJMsDW3W

The British military announced that it would send its most sophisticated multiple-launch rocket system to Ukraine, joining the U.S. in providing long-range artillery as Russia hits Ukrainian positions across the eastern front. https://t.co/FyYYc1noHg

Three people were killed and 12 others were injured, officials said, in a shooting on a packed street in downtown Philadelphia.
Other shootings in Tennessee, Virginia, Arizona and South Carolina over the weekend left six more dead and dozens injured. https://t.co/xXWxNxegxc

Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain will face a no-confidence vote that could force him from power.
Follow our live updates. https://t.co/et1ZfYzBeg https://t.co/p5B8x4akFQ

California has some 700 certified farmers’ markets, featuring some of the world’s best produce — but it took legislative changes in the 1970s to help them flourish. https://t.co/LiaUFpa663 https://t.co/EwObwjB9N9

Queen Elizabeth II joined other members of the royal family on the balcony of Buckingham Palace, as four days of Platinum Jubilee celebrations came to an end on Sunday. https://t.co/YZ4ny7Ge2I https://t.co/MIbBanbngP

The New York Times assessed four key gun-control proposals currently before Congress and found that they could have changed the course of dozens of mass shootings since the Columbine massacre in 1999. https://t.co/YbS6nB39wQ

Platinum Jubilee celebrations ended Sunday, with Queen Elizabeth II making another appearance on the Buckingham Palace balcony.
On Monday, Britain pivots from joyful tributes to the queen’s 70-year reign to renewed political ructions over Boris Johnson. https://t.co/C2jzmgFa7R https://t.co/dgzuh2jrBQ

Dozens were believed to be dead in southwestern Nigeria after assailants attacked a Catholic church on Sunday, firing on worshipers as they celebrated Mass, officials said. It was the deadliest attack on a church in years in Africa’s most populous nation. https://t.co/VopVcshQl4

It was a small trial, just 18 rectal cancer patients, every one of whom took the same drug.
But the results were astonishing. The cancer vanished in every single patient, and no further treatment was necessary. https://t.co/bW2SRCE5ft

For months after Russia invaded their country, the members of Ukraine’s national soccer team were unable to hold so much as a practice together, let alone play a game.
On Sunday, they will play Wales for a place in the World Cup. https://t.co/W5WjfAbsI2

Rafael Nadal on Sunday extended his men’s singles record of 22 Grand Slam titles with a win in straight sets over Casper Ruud. The victory secured Nadal his 14th men’s singles title at the tournament, extending a French Open record. https://t.co/maRQonAR56 https://t.co/aKG3sPhDR8

"There were a lot of happy tears."
It was a small trial, just 18 rectal cancer patients, every one of whom took the same drug.
But the results were astonishing. The cancer vanished in every single patient. https://t.co/mYnlfUkKAs
Breaking News: Rafael Nadal beat Casper Ruud for his 14th title in Paris and his 22nd major trophy, extending his lead on the all-time list. https://t.co/UOu0W0hW66

A boy who played Little League. A girl who dreamed of becoming a veterinarian. Several children who had just made the honor roll.
In all, 21 people — 19 students and two teachers — were killed by a gunman in Uvalde, Texas. These are their stories. https://t.co/T066oSv1Nv

John Fetterman, a heart patient, will be battling Dr. Mehmet Oz, a heart surgeon, in Pennsylvania for the Senate seat deemed most within reach for a Democratic takeover. Fetterman's recent health struggles have left some Democrats with a distinct unease. https://t.co/FUx1d80wkS
Here is a collection of booze-free beverages for the season. https://t.co/EFyIh5P3j0 https://t.co/ycBVpU9uyp

The police chief who oversaw the response to a mass shooting in Uvalde, Texas, arrived on scene without his police radio, a law enforcement official said. A tactical team ultimately ignored directives not to breach the classroom. https://t.co/oxClOIGg1c

A former Air Force sergeant who participated online in an extremist anti-government movement was sentenced to 41 years in prison for murdering a federal security officer and injuring another outside a courthouse in Oakland, California. https://t.co/8Yq2O1yKOs

“We value the comfort and self-regard of men, especially famous ones, more than we value the safety and dignity of women, even famous ones,” our critic writes on the Johnny Depp-Amber Heard trial verdict. https://t.co/tNWFewWQBJ

An emergency services dispatcher in Buffalo who was accused of hanging up on a 911 call from a supermarket employee during the mass shooting in May has been fired. The employee said the dispatcher yelled at her for whispering as she hid during the attack. https://t.co/ytiXrh11cY

President Emmanuel Macron of France, who has sought to position himself as the world’s chief negotiator with the Kremlin, pleaded Saturday to not "humiliate" Russia.
Ukraine’s foreign minister said Macron's advice "can only humiliate France." https://t.co/DWbIoZdhkI

Dozens of mariachi musicians had traveled to Uvalde with the hope that they could deliver a dose of comfort. With trumpets, strings and serenades, their music speaks to a community’s profound sorrow. https://t.co/aefNYCmhbm https://t.co/N2Ay5XaKt7
Drivers in Miami faced slashing rains and flooded streets as a rapidly growing weather system moved into the South Florida region. https://t.co/zMSiS73aLq https://t.co/IURSembeBz

If ever there was a potent symbol of how much Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has altered Europe, the sight of this enormous battleship in Stockholm, bristling with 26 warplanes and 2,400 Marines and sailors, would certainly be it. https://t.co/VKf2iDHQjC https://t.co/sRMB3lyxpA

If four key gun control proposals now being considered in Congress had been law since the Columbine High School in 1999, they might have changed the course of 35 mass shootings that killed 446, a New York Times analysis found. https://t.co/DQEllQAcfi

A 150-mile leisurely bike ride from Trieste, Italy, through Slovenia, to the ancient city of Pula, Croatia, brims with ancient traditions, sublime food and perched-village photo ops. https://t.co/xB4y3iVKMZ https://t.co/fR4IndCwIy

Raquel Fortun is one of only two forensic pathologists in the Philippines. Before her, there had been no independent inquiry into the country's drug war. She has used her skills to show how other doctors falsely claimed some victims died natural deaths. https://t.co/ySiccf2z0V https://t.co/3qIp1F0KtJ

Special Olympics lifted its Covid vaccine requirement for athletes and staff after Florida officials threatened a $27.5 million fine over the mandate. Gov. Ron DeSantis, who has blocked vaccine and mask mandates, criticized the requirement on Friday. https://t.co/u6sBybMQJc
Breaking News: The Justice Department declined to charge Mark Meadows and Dan Scavino, two former Trump aides, for stonewalling the Jan. 6 inquiry. https://t.co/EWblVEZLli

Dozens of mariachi musicians had traveled to Uvalde with the hope that they could deliver a dose of comfort. With trumpets, strings and serenades, their music speaks to a community’s profound sorrow. https://t.co/m9iO3mpZ8f https://t.co/X2lju8kcPd
